basics.name: Paul Kilmurray
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Seasoned software developer and entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience in web development, specialising in e-commerce, custom WordPress/WooCommerce plugins, and point-of-sale (POS) software solutions. Expert in modern web technologies including React, React Native, Node.js, PHP, and REST APIs. Proven track record in delivering innovative, scalable solutions for a diverse client base ranging from startups to established businesses worldwide.

work.name: Slurp Noodles Ltd
summary: Customise and maintain an in-house Point-of-Sale (POS) system, ensuring seamless integration with accounting and CRM platforms.
Optimise system performance and scalability while ensuring compliance with data protection and security standards.
Provide staff training, technical support, and comprehensive documentation to enhance system usability.
Develop automated reporting tools to deliver actionable business insights.

work.name: The Kilbot Factory
summary: Operate as a sole trader, delivering bespoke web development, hosting, and IT solutions to a global clientele under The Kilbot Factory brand.
Develop and maintain WooCommerce POS, a highly-rated WordPress plugin adopted by thousands of businesses worldwide for streamlined WooCommerce point-of-sale operations.
Create custom e-commerce solutions, including tailored WordPress/WooCommerce plugins, API integrations, and specialised tools for diverse industries.
Collaborate with clients to design and deliver scalable, high-performance web applications and workflow optimizations.

clients.name: F Coffee Ltd
clients.summary: Developed custom POS and plugin features for their retail operations.

clients.name: Underdog Film Lab
clients.summary: Built specialised tools for inventory and workflow management.

work.name: Urban Locavore
summary: Founded and operated a subscription-based food delivery service, curating high-quality products from Western Australian farmers' markets.
Designed and maintained the company's WooCommerce-powered platform, which facilitated seamless ordering and subscription management.
Created a bespoke POS system to optimize inventory and logistics, later adapted into WooCommerce POS.

work.name: BioCenturion
summary: Worked with an Australian startup to develop a glucose tracking application for the first-generation iPhone.
Led front-end and back-end development using cutting-edge tools for mobile health monitoring, though the project was ultimately discontinued.

work.name: The Kilbot Factory
summary: Delivered custom websites, hosting solutions, and IT consulting services for businesses across diverse industries.

clients.name: Tim Minchin
clients.summary: Created and managed digital assets for prominent clients, including Tim Minchin (website and mailing list management).

clients.name: Huge Object
clients.summary: Developed responsive, cross-browser-compatible websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

interests: Passionate about learning Spanish to enhance communication skills and cultural understanding.
Enjoy surfing as a way to stay active and connect with nature.
Deeply interested in blockchain technology, with a focus on exploring innovative payment methods and their potential applications.

projects.name: WooCommerce POS
projects.description: Point of Sale application for WooCommerce.
highlights: Cross platform application built with React Native, Nativewind, Expo and RxDB

projects.name: Medusa POS
projects.description: Point of Sale application for Medusa JS.
highlights: Cross platform application currently in development

achievements: Successfully transitioned from web hosting services to specialized WooCommerce plugin development, carving out a niche in POS solutions.
Managed long-term relationships with diverse clients, delivering value through tailored solutions and ongoing support.
Self-taught advanced programming skills, adapting to new technologies and market demands over two decades.
